1.text: Buy gold or copper crafting wire from your local craft store.

2.text: Choose a flower to replicate for your project.

3.text: Cut pieces of wire that are the same size for however many petals you need.

4.text: Create a loop with each piece of wire and twist the ends together.

5.text: Create a ridge on your petals by crimping the wire with jewelry pliers.

6.text: Pull a piece of stocking over the petal and tie it in place with a piece of thread.

7.text: Cut away any excess stocking material from the petal.

8.text: Cut a 6–8 in (150–200 mm) piece of wire to use as the flower’s stem.

9.text: Loop the end of the stem around the middle of 3-4 plastic stamens.

10.text: Tie the first petal to the stem using thread.

11.text: Add the additional petals, slightly overlapping them to create a full bloom.

12.text: Wrap green florist tape around the stem from the bottom of the petals down.

13.text: Adjust the petals if needed by bending them to make them look more realistic.

14.text: Use a marker to draw small details on each petal.

15.text: Add small green leaves to the stem to make your flower more realistic.

16.text: Attach buds that haven’t blossomed yet to add more detail.

17.text: “Pot” your flowers in a container filled with floral foam to finish your project.
